titles: To the honourable, the knights, citizens, and burgesses of the House of Common [sic] by Gods goodnesse assembled, and by his gratious good providence hitherto preserved in Parliament the humble petition of divers barronets, knights, esquires, gentlemen, ministers, freeholders, and others of the County of Darby, to the number of 7077.
notes: Thanks God, the King, and Parliament for freeing the bishops from political distractions, and for beginning the relief of Ireland. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Church of England --  Bishops --  Early works to 1800.
